Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water.
Evidence Statements: The student can draw a plant that has enough water and looks healthy.
The student can draw a plant that does not have enough water and looks unhealthy.
The student can show in their drawing that plants need water to grow by illustrating the differences between a healthy and an unhealthy plant.
The student can demonstrate through their drawing that both animals and plants need water.
The student can illustrate a pattern by showing multiple plants that all need water in their drawing.
